content:
hey all, i've spent this week writing an embedding API for wasmtime in zig and i'm wondering if it's possible to transfer the repo to the bytecodealliance org on github?

GitHub - dotcarmen/zig-wasmtime
Contribute to dotcarmen/zig-wasmtime development by creating an account on GitHub.

I think this is something you'll want to bring up with BA's TSC. Currently though the hosting in the BA generally requires a BA member organization to be on the hook for maintenance, and we don't currently have any community-maintained wasmtime bindings at this time. If you're curious though we do mention community-supported bindings in the Wasmtime README

GitHub - bytecodealliance/wasmtime: A lightweight WebAssembly runtime that is fast, secure, and standards-compliant
A lightweight WebAssembly runtime that is fast, secure, and standards-compliant - bytecodealliance/wasmtime

@.carmen, we talked about this a bit in the TSC today. If you're still interested in contributing this project to the BA, can you take a look at the hosted project document? The idea with that is to submit a PR explaining how, e.g., the project will be maintained going forward. Any thoughts on who else could help you maintain the project?

governance/templates/projects/proposal-hosted-project.md at main · bytecodealliance/governance
Documents related to Bytecode Alliance governance and process - bytecodealliance/governance
